field.note: Choose the locations in the asset tree from which you want to list events. For each location you can specify a CSS class, or one of the CSS named colours, to use when displaying events from that location. (The CSS named colours are black, blue, fuchsia, gray, green, lime, maroon, navy, olive, purple, red, silver, teal, white and yellow).
If you set this to 'yes', events will only be shown if they are linked somewhere under the current user as well as under one of the locations specified above.
Choose which calendar views you want to be available on the frontend, and their style.
Choose the first view you want frontend users to see

Text for the link that takes the user to the next-broadest view (eg up from day view to week view). The keyword %v% is available in this text, and will be replaced with the name of the next-broadest view.

Text for the link that takes the user to the previous period in the current view (eg from September to August). The keyword %v% is available in this text, and will be replaced with the name of the current view.

Text for the link that takes the user to the next period in the current view (eg from January to February). The keyword %v% is available in this text, and will be replaced with the name of the current view.
If you enable description popups, the description of an event will appear as a popup when you move the mouse pointer over the event in month, week or day view
If you enable week links, the calendar-format month view will display a link to the relevant week view at the start of each row

Only days enabled here will be displayed in week view.
The order in which the days are displayed is controlled by the 'First Day in Week' setting above.

field.note: Consider this as the number of events you expect to normally occur concurrently. If you leave it blank or zero, event widths will be set only according to the number of events actually present. However if you enter a nonzero value, event widths will be set so that there is always room for this number of events to sit side by side, even if fewer than this number of events are actually present
If you choose an asset builder page for this field, users will be able to click on empty cells in the calendar display to go to the asset builder page and add an event for that timeslot
If you enable drag-and-drop editing, users with appropriate access will be able to drag single calendar events and drop them at another point in time.
Choose which event sources should have their own columns
If the 'other' column is the only column, its default name is 'Events'; otherwise the default is 'Other'. Enter a column name here to override these defaults
